title: Enable 100+ notifications via oboarding
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user that has just added the app to their device
custom_steps: WHEN the user adds 100+ notifications via on-boarding
custom_expected:
THEN the notifications are successfully saved
AND the user receives the notifications to which they subscribed
AND the user does NOT receive notifications to which they did NOT subscribe

title: Force close and reopen (session test)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user that has the app installed
AND 100+ notifications are selected by the user
custom_steps:
WHEN the user force closes the app
AND reopens the app
custom_expected:
THEN the user's notifications settings should be preserved
AND the user should receive notifications to which they are subscribed
AND the user should NOT receive notifications to which they are NOT subscribed

title: Disable 100+ notifications via settings
custom_preconds:
Given a user that has the app installed
AND the user had 100+ notifications selected
custom_steps: WHEN the user disables 100+ notifications via Settings
custom_expected:
THEN the user's notification settings changes will be retained
AND the user will receive notifications to which they are subscribed
AND the user will NOT receive notifications to which they are NOT subscribed

title: Force close re-open while notifications disabled
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user with the app installed
AND no notifications are enabled
custom_steps:
WHEN the user force closes the app
AND reopens the app
custom_expected:
THEN the user's notification settings will be retained
AND the user will not receive notifications

title: Enable 100+ notifications via Settings
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user that has the app installed
AND no notifications are selected
custom_expected:
THEN the user's notification settings should be preserved
AND the user should receive notifications to which they are subscribed
AND the user should NOT receive notifications to which they are NOT subscribed

title: Migration to OneSignal succeeds when upgrading from 9.4.0 to 9.4.3+ if DSS notification service is enabled and https://onesignal.com is not blocked
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user with 9.4.0 installed on their device
AND  DSS notification service is enabled and https://onesignal.com is not blocked(use Charles to simulate)
custom_steps:
WHEN the user upgrades to 9.4.3+
AND launches the app
custom_expected: THEN the user is successfully migrated to OneSignal

title: A single 401 error for https://engage-messaging.bamgrid.com/user-channel/v1/push-channels/... occurs if DSS notification service is disabled at the time of migration.
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user that has upgraded from 9.4.0 to 9.4.3+
AND DSS Notifications are disabled
custom_steps: WHEN the user opens the app
custom_expected: THEN a single occurrence of a 401 error should occur (appears in Charles  https://engage-messaging.bamgrid.com/user-channel/v1/push-channels/)

title: A single POST https://onesignal.com/api/v1/players/.../on_session request occurs
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user that has upgraded from 9.4.0 to 9.4.3+
AND the user has not yet launched the app
AND DSS notification service is disabled during the launch flow
custom_steps: WHEN the user launches the app
custom_expected:
THEN OneSignal migrations succeeds without entering a retry loop
AND tags are updated successfully

title: Multiple POST https://onesignal.com/api/v1/players/.../on_session requests occur during the launch flow if OneSignal tag updates fail, such as when https://onesignal.com is blocked. Note: The retry interval is 10 seconds.
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user that has upgraded from 9.4.0 to 9.4.3+
AND https://onesignal.com is blocked
custom_expected: THEN the launch flow will enter a retry loop (This will be indicated by multiple POSTS to https://onesignal.com/api/v1/players/.../on_session in Charles) with a 10 second interval in between each attempt (max retry count is 3 so four occurrences are expected)

title: No "Problem saving notification settings. Tap to retry." notification is displayed
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user that has upgraded from 9.4.0 to 9.4.3+
AND user has not yet launched the app
AND DSS notification service is disabled
custom_expected:
THEN OneSignal tags update successfully
AND No "Problem saving notification settings. Tap to retry." notification is displayed

title: "Problem saving notification settings. Tap to retry." notification is displayed when saving notification settings if OneSignal tag updates fail, such as when https://onesignal.com is blocked
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user that has upgraded from 9.4.0 to 9.4.3+
AND user has not yet launched the app
AND Onesignal notification service is blocked (through Charles)
custom_expected:
THEN "Problem saving notification settings. Tap to retry." notification is displayed
AND OneSignal tag updates fail

title: No https://engage-messaging.bamgrid.com/... calls occur, either during the launch flow or when saving notification settings, if deregistration with DSS notification service succeeded previously.
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user that has successfully gone through the migration process
custom_steps:
WHEN the user launches the app
AND when the user makes adjustments to notification settings
custom_expected: THEN No https://engage-messaging.bamgrid.com/... calls occur (Check in Charles)

title: No https://engage-messaging.bamgrid.com/... calls occur, either during the launch flow or when saving notification settings, if no previous app data is cached at the time 9.4.3+ is installed
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user that freshly installs 9.4.3+
custom_steps:
WHEN the user launches the app
AND when the user makes adjustments to notification settings
custom_expected: THEN No https://engage-messaging.bamgrid.com/... calls occur (Check in Charles)

title: Migration to OneSignal succeeds when upgrading from 9.4.0 to 9.4.3+ if DSS notification service is disabled and https://onesignal.com is not blocked.
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user with 9.4.0 installed on their device
AND DSS notification service is disabled and https://onesignal.com is not blocked(use Charles to simulate)
AND the user upgrades to 9.4.3+
custom_steps: WHEN the user launches the app
custom_expected: THEN the user is successfully migrated to OneSignal

title: OneSignal notifications are received after successful migration
custom_preconds: GIVEN a user that freshly installs 9.4.3+
custom_steps: WHEN the user launches the app
custom_expected:
THEN the user is successfully registered with OneSignal
AND tags are updated
